gurmukhi: ੴ> ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪ੍ਰਸਾਦਿ ||
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ੧ ਮੰਗਲਾਚਰਣ ਵਸਤੂ ਨਿਰਦੇਸ਼
transliteration: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?
translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰਾ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਜਾਣੀਅੈ ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰਾ ਥਾਟ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Pooraa Satiguru Jaaneeai Pooray Pooraa Daatu Banaaiaa.
translation: One should understand the perfect true Guru who has created the grandeur  (of creation) around.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗੁ ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰਾ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਦ੍ਰਿੜਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Pooray Pooraa Saadhasangu Pooray Pooraa Mantr Drirhaaiaa.
translation: The holy congregation of the complete is perfect and  that perfect has recited the perfect mantra.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰਾ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸੁ ਪੂਰਾ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥੁ ਚਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Pooray Pooraa Piram Rasu Pooraa Guramoukhi Pandu Chalaaiaa.
translation: The perfect has created the  complete love for the Lord and has ordained the gurmukh way of life.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰਾ ਦਰਸਣੋ ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰਾ ਸਬਦੁ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Pooray Pooraa Darasano Pooray Pooraa Sabadu Sounaaiaa.
translation: The  sight of perfect is perfect and the same perfect has caused to hear the  perfect word.

gurmukhi: ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰਾ ਬੈਹਣਾ ਪੂਰੇ ਪੂਰਾ ਤਖਤੁ ਰਚਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Pooray Pooraa Baihanaa Pooray Pooraa Takhatu Rachaaiaa.
translation: His sitting is also perfect and his throne is also perfect.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚੁ ਖੰਡ ਹੈ ਭਗਤਿ ਵਛਲ ਹੁੲਿ ਵਸਗਤਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Sachu Khandu Hai Bhagati Vachhalu Hoi Vasagati Aaiaa.
translation: The  holy congregation is the abode of truth and being kind to the devotee, He  is in the possession of the devotees.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚੁ ਨਾੳੁ ਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨੁ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਸਿਖਾ ਸਮਝਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Sachu Roopu Sachu Naau Gur Giaanu Dhiaanu Sikhaa Samajhaaiaa.
translation: The Guru, out of his sheer love for  the Sikhs, has made them understand the true nature of the Lord, the true  name and the knowledge-producing meditation.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਚੇਲੇ ਪਰਚਾ ਪਰਚਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧||
transliteration: Gur Chaylay Parachaa Parachaaiaa ?1?
translation: The Guru has immersed  the disciple in the way of life.

gurmukhi: ੳੁਹੋ ਹੀ
translation: Invocation

gurmukhi: ਕਰਣ ਕਾਰਣ ਸਮਰਥੁ ਹੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਦਾ ਕਰੈ ਕਰਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Karan Kaaran Samaradu Hai Saadhasangati Daa Karai Karaaiaa.
translation: All competent God Himself is the efficient as well as material cause of all  but He does everything according to the will of the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਭਰੈ ਭੰਡਾਰ ਦਾਤਾਰ ਹੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਦਾ ਦੇੲਿ ਦਿਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bharai Bhandaar Daataaru Hai Saadhasangati Daa Dayi Divaaiaa.
translation: The  stores of that bestower are full but he gives according to the wishes of the  holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਗੁਰ ਰੂਪੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਸਮਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Paarabraham Gur Roopu Hoi Saadhasangati Gur Sabadi Samaaiaa.
translation: That transcendental Brahm, by being the Guru, enrapts  the holy congregation into the Word, sabad.

gurmukhi: ਜਗ ਭੋਗ ਜੋਗ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਕਰਿ ਪੂਜਾ ਪਰੈ ਨ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Jag Bhog Jog Dhiaanu Kari Poojaa Parai N Darasanu Paaiaa.
translation: His glimpse can not be had by  performing of yajna, offering sweets, yoga, concentration, ritualistic  worship and ablutions.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਪਿੳੁ ਪੁਤੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਦਿਤਾ ਖਾੲਿ ਪੈਨ੍ਹੈ ਪੈਨ੍ਹਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Piu Poutu Hoi Ditaa Khaai Painhai Painhaaiaa.
translation: Fellows in the holy congregation maintain father-son  relationship with the Guru,

gurmukhi: ਘਰਬਾਰੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਵਰਤਿਅਾ ਘਰਬਾਰੀ ਸਿਖ ਪੈਰੀ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gharabaaree Hoi Varatiaa Gharabaaree Sikh Pairee Paaiaa.
translation: And whatever he gives to eat and put on, they eat  and wear.

gurmukhi: ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਦਾਸੁ ਰਖਾੲਿਅਾ ||੨||
transliteration: Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Rakhaaiaa ?2?
translation: God remains detached in maya.

gurmukhi: ੩ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਾਂ ਦੀ ਨਿੱਤ ਕ੍ਰਿਯਾ
translation: Daily routine of Gurmukhs

gurmukhi: ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਵੇਲੇ ੳੁਠਿ ਕੈ ਜਾੲਿ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਦਰੀਅਾੲਿ ਨ੍ਹਵੰਦੇ
transliteration: Anmrit Vaylay Outdi Kai Jaai Andari Dareeaau Nhavanday.
translation: Getting up at the ambrosial hour of morning the Sikhs bathe in the river.

gurmukhi: ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾਧਿ ਅਗਾਧਿ ਵਿਚਿ ੲਿਕ ਮਨਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਗੁਰ ਜਾਪੁ ਜਪੰਦੇ
transliteration: Sahaji Samaadhi Agaadhi Vichi Ik Mani Hoi Gur Jaapu Japanday.
translation: By putting their mind in the unfathomable God through deep  concentration, they remember Guru, the God by reciting Japu (Ji).

gurmukhi: ਮਥੈ ਟਿਕੇ ਲਾਲ ਲਾੲਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਚਲਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਬਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Madai Tikay Laal Laai Saadhasangati Chali Jaai Bahanday.
translation: Getting fully activated then they go to join the holy congregation of the saints.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦੁ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵਲੀਣੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਬਾਣੀ ਗਾੲਿ ਸੁਣੰਦੇ
transliteration: Sabadu Surati Liv Leenu Hoi Satigur Baanee Gaai Sounanday.
translation: Becoming absorbed in remembering and loving the sabad they sing and  hear the Guru's hymns.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਭੈ ਵਰਤਮਾਨ ਗੁਰ ਸੇਵਾ ਗੁਰਪੁਰਬ ਕਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Bhaai Bhagati Bhai Varatimaani Gur Sayvaa Gurapurab Karanday.
translation: They love to spend their time in meditation,  service and fear of God and they serve the Gum by observing his  anniversaries.

gurmukhi: ਸੰਝੈ ਸੋਦਰੁ ਗਾਵਣਾ ਮਨ ਮੇਲੀ ਕਰਿ ਮੇਲਿ ਮਿਲੰਦੇ
transliteration: Sanjhai Sodaru Gaavanaa Man Maylee Kari Mayli Miladay.
translation: They sing the Sodar in the evening and heartily associate  with one another.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਤੀ ਕੀਰਤਿ ਸੋਹਿਲਾ ਕਰਿ ਅਾਰਤੀ ਪਰਸਾਦ ਵੰਡੰਦੇ
transliteration: Raatee Keerati Sohilaa Kari Aaratee Parasaadu Vandanday.
translation: Having recited the Sohila and made supplication at night  they distribute sacred food (prasad).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਪਿਰਮ ਚਖੰਦੇ ||੩||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Chakhanday ?3?
translation: Thus gurmukhs gladly taste the fruit  of happiness.

gurmukhi: ੪ ਸਾਧ ਸੰਗਤਿ-ਸਚਖੰਡ
translation: Holy congregation, abode the truth -

gurmukhi: ੲਿਕ ਕਵਾੳੁ ਪਸਾੳੁ ਕਰਿ ਓਅੰਕਾਰਿ ਅਕਾਰ ਪਸਾਰਾ
transliteration: Ik Kavaau Pasaau Kari Aoankaari Akaaru Pasaaraa.
translation: The Oankar Lord, with one resonance created the forms.

gurmukhi: ਪੳੁਣ ਪਾਣੀ ਬੈਸੰਤਰੋ ਧਰਤਿ ਅਾਗਾਸੁ ਧਰੇ ਨਿਰਧਾਰਾ
transliteration: Paoun Paanee Baisantaro Dharati Agaasu Dharay Niradhaaraa.
translation: Air, water, fire,  sky and earth He sustained (in his order) without any support.

gurmukhi: ਰੋਮ ਰੋਮ ਵਿਚਿ ਰਖਿਓਨੁ ਕਰਿ ਵਰਭੰਡ ਕਰੋੜਿ ਅਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Rom Rom Vichi Rakhiaonu Kari Varabhand Karorhi Akaaraa.
translation: Millions of  universe exist in his each trichome.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਅਗਮ ਅਗੋਚਰ ਅਲਖ ਅਪਾਰਾ
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Agam Agocharu Alakh Apaaraa.
translation: He the transcendental Brahm is the  complete   (within  and  without),   inaccessible,   imperceptible  incomprehensible and infinite.

gurmukhi: ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲੈ ਵਸਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਵਛਲ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਿਰਜਣਹਾਰਾ
transliteration: Piram Piaalai Vasi Hoi Bhagati Vachhal Hoi Sirajanahaaraa.
translation: He remains in the control of loving  devotion and by becoming kind to the devotees, He creates.

gurmukhi: ਬੀੳੁ ਬੀਜਿ ਅਤਿ ਸੂਖਮੋ ਤਿਦੂ ਹੋੲਿ ਵਡ ਬਿਰਖ ਵਿਥਾਰਾ
transliteration: Beeu Beeji Ati Sookhamo Tidoon Hoi Vad Birakh Vidaaraa.
translation: He is the  subtle seed that takes form of the large tree of creation.

gurmukhi: ਫਲ ਵਿਚਿ ਬੀੳੁ ਸਮਾੲਿਕੈ ੲਿਕ ਦੂੰ ਬੀਅਹੁ ਲਖ ਹਜਾਰਾ
transliteration: Phal Vichi Beeu Samaai Kai Ik Doon Beeahu Lakh Hajaaraa.
translation: The fruits contain  seeds and then from one seed millions of fruits are created.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸੁ ਗੁਰਸਿਖਾਂ ਸਤਿਗੁਰੂ ਪਿਅਾਰਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Piram Rasu Gurasikhaan Satiguroo Piaaraa.
translation: The sweet  fruit of Gurmukhs is the love of Lord and the Sikhs of Guru love the true  Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚਖੰਡ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਵਸੈ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰਾ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Sachu Khand Vichi Satigur Purakhu Vasai Nirankaaraa.
translation: In the holy congregation, the abode of truth, the supreme formless  Lord resides.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਨਿਸਤਾਰਾ ||੪||
transliteration: Bhaai Bhagati Guramoukhi Nisataaraa ?4?
translation: The Gurmukhs get liberated through loving devotion.

gurmukhi: ੫ ਜਪੁਜੀ ਅੰਤਲੇ ਸਲੋਕ ਪਵਣ ਗੁਰੂ ਦਾ ਅਰਥ
translation: The meaning of the 38th stanza of japuji-pavn-Guru pani pita

gurmukhi: ਪੳੁਣ ਗੁਰੂ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦੁ ਹੈ ਵਾਹਿਗੁਰੂ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Paounu Guroo Gur Sabadu Hai Vaahaguroo Gur Sabadu Sounaaiaa.
translation: The Guru's word is the air, the Guru and wondrous lord has recited Word the  Guru.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣੀ ਪਿਤਾ ਪਵਿਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥ ਨਿਵਾਣਿ ਚਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Paanee Pitaa Pavitr Kari Guramoukhi Panthi Nivaani Chalaaiaa.
translation: The father of man is water which by flowing downwards teaches humility.

gurmukhi: ਧਰਤੀ ਮਾਤ ਮਹਤ ਕਰਿ ਓਤਿਪੋਤਿ ਸੰਜੋਗੁ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dharatee Maat Mahatu Kari Aoti Poti Sanjogu Banaaiaa.
translation: The earth being tolerant like mother is the mother and is the further base of all the  creatures.

gurmukhi: ਦਾੲੀ ਦਾੲਿਅਾ ਰਾਤਿ ਦਿਹੁ ਬਾਲ ਸੁਭਾੲਿ ਜਗਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਖਿਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Daaee Daaiaa Raati Dihu Baal Soubhaai Jagatr Khilaaiaa.
translation: The day and night are the nurses who keep the people of child-wisdom  busy in the plays of the world.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਜਨਮ ਸਕਾਰਥਾ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਵਸਿ ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Janamu Sakaaradaa Saadhasangati Vasi Aapu Gavaaiaa.
translation: The life of Gurmukh is meaningful because he in  the holy congregation has lost his egotism.

gurmukhi: ਜੰਮਣ ਮਰਣਹੁ ਬਾਹਰੇ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਵਰਤਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Janman Maranahu Baaharay Jeevan Moukati Jougati Varataaiaa.
translation: He becoming liberated in life behaves  in the 'world with the skill to come out of the cycle of transrnigration.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਮਾਤਾ ਮਤਿ ਹੈ ਪਿਤਾ ਸੰਤੋਖ ਮੋਖ ਪਦੁ ਪਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramati Maataa Mati Hai Pitaa Santokh Mokh Padu Paaiaa.
translation: The mother  of the gurmukhs is the wisdom of the Guru and father, the contentment through  whom they attain deliverance.

gurmukhi: ਧੀਰਜ ਧਰਮੁ ਭਿਰਾਵ ਦੁੲਿ ਜਪੁ ਤਪੁ ਜਤੁ ਸਤੁ ਪੁਤ ਜਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dheeraju Dharamu Bhiraav Dui Japu Tapu Jatu Satu Pout Janaaiaa.
translation: Forbearance and the sense of duty are their  brothers, and meditation, austetities, continence the sons.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਚੇਲਾ ਚੇਲਾ ਗੁਰੂ ਪੁਰਖਹੁ ਪੁਰਖ ਚਲਤੁ ਵਰਤਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Gur Chaylaa Chaylaa Guroo Purakhahu Purakh Chalatu Varataaiaa.
translation: The Guru and the  disciple are diffused into one another in equanirnity and they both are the  extension of the perfect supreme Lord.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਅਲਖੁ ਲਖਾੲਿਅਾ ||੫||
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhaaiaa ?5?
translation: Raving realized the supreme pleasure they  have made others also realize the same.

gurmukhi: ੬ ਨਿਰਲੇਪਤਾ ਪੁਰ ਦ੍ਰਿਸ਼ਟਿ
translation: Detachment

gurmukhi: ਪਰ ਘਰ ਜਾੲਿ ਪਰਾਹੁਣਾ ਅਾਸਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਨਿਰਾਸੁ ਵਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Par Ghar Jaai Paraahounaa Aasaa Vichi Niraasu Valaaay.
translation: The guest in the house of other person remains unconcerned among many  expectations.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਕਵਲ ਜਿੳੁ ਸੂਰਜ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਅਲਿਪਤੁ ਰਹਾੲੇ
transliteration: Paanee Andari Kaval Jiu Sooraj Dhiaanu Alipatu Rahaaay.
translation: Lotus too in the water concentrates upon sun and remains- uninfluenced  by water.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਸਤਿਸੰਗਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਗੁਰ ਚੇਲੇ ਦੀ ਸੰਧਿ ਮਿਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Satisangi Mili Gur Chaylay Dee Sandhi Milaaay.
translation: Likewise in the holy congregation the Guru and disciple  meet through word (sabad) and meditative faculty(surati).

gurmukhi: ਚਾਰ ਵਰਨ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚਖੰਡ ਵਸਾੲੇ
transliteration: Chaari Varan Gurasikh Hoi Saadhasangati Sach Khand Vasaaay.
translation: People of the four  varnas, by becoming followers of the Guru, reside in the abode of truth through  the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪੁ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਤੰਬੋਲ ਰਸੁ ਖਾੲਿ ਚਬਾੲਿ ਸੁ ਰੰਗ ਚੜ੍ਹਾੲੇ
transliteration: Aapu Gavaai Tanbol Rasu Khaai Chabaai Su Rang Charhhaaay.
translation: Like the one coloured sap of betel-leaf they shed away  their selfhood, and all are coloured in their one fast colour.

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨ ਤਰਸਨ ਖੜੇ ਬਾਰਹ ਪੰਥ ਗਿਰੰਥ ਸੁਣਾੲੇ
transliteration: Chhia Darasan Tarasan Kharhay Baarah Panthi Girand Sounaaay.
translation: All the six  philosophies and the twelve sects of yogis covet by standing away (but do not get  that status because of their pride).

gurmukhi: ਛਿਅ ਰੁਤਿ ਬਾਰਹ ਮਾਸ ਕਰਿ ੲਿਕੁ ੲਿਕੁ ਸੂਰਜੁ ਚੰਦ ਦਿਖਾੲੇ
transliteration: Chhia Routi Baarah Maas Kari Iku Iku Sooraju Chandu Dikhaaay.
translation: Six seasons, twelve months are shown to have  one sun and one moon,

gurmukhi: ਬਾਰਹ ਸੋਲਹ ਮੇਲਿਕੈ ਸਸੀਅਰ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਸੂਰ ਸਮਾੲੇ
transliteration: Baarah Solah Mayli Kai Saseear Andari Soor Samaaay.
translation: But the gurmukhs have fused the sun and the moon into  each other, i.e. they have demolished the boundries of the sattva and the rajas  gunas.

gurmukhi: ਸਿਵ ਸਕਤੀ ਨੂੰ ਲੰਘਿ ਕੈ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ੲਿਕ ਮਨਿ ੲਿਕੁ ਧਿਅਾੲੇ
transliteration: Siv Sakatee No Laghi Kai Guramoukhi Iku Manu Iku Dhiaaay.
translation: Having gone beyond the rnaya of Siva-sakti they medicate upon the one supreme.

gurmukhi: ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਜਗੁ ਪੈਰੀ ਪਾੲੇ ||੬||
transliteration: Pairee Pai Jagu Pairee Paaay ?6?
translation: Their humility makes the world fall at their feet.

gurmukhi: ੭ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਰਹਿਣੀ
translation: Conduct of Gurmukhs

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਅਵੇਸ ਕਰਿ ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਕਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Gur Oupadays Adaysu Kari Pairee Pai Raharaasi Karanday.
translation: Considering the sermon of the Guru as the order they observe the code being bumble.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਸਰਣਿ ਮਸਤਕੁ ਧਰਨਿ ਚਰਨ ਰੇਣ ਮੁਖਿ ਤਿਲਕ ਸੁਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Charan Sarani Masataku Dharani Charan Raynu Moukhi Tilak Suhanday.
translation: They surrender at the feet of Guru and apply he dust of  his-feet to their heads.

gurmukhi: ਭਰਮ ਕਰਮ ਦਾ ਲੇਖ ਮੇਟਿ ਲੇਖੁ ਅਲੇਖ ਵਿਸੇਖ ਬਣੰਦੇ
transliteration: Bharam Karam Daa Laykhu Mayti Laykhu Alaykh Visaykh Bananday.
translation: By effacing the delusive writings of destiny, they  create special love for imperceptible God.

gurmukhi: ਜਗਮਗ ਜੋਤਿ ੳੁਦੋਤ ਕਰਿ ਸੂਰਜ ਚੰਦ ਨ ਲਖ ਪੁਜੰਦੇ
transliteration: Jagamag Joti Udotu Kari Sooraj Chand N Lakh Pujanday.
translation: Myriads of suns and moons  cannot reach their effulgence.

gurmukhi: ਹੳੁਮੈ ਗਰਬੁ ਨਿਵਾਰਿਕੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਚ ਮੇਲਿ ਮਿਲੰਦੇ
transliteration: Haoumai Garabu Nivaari Kai Saadhasangati Sar Mayli Miladay.
translation: Deleting ego from themselves they take dip  into the sacred tank of the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਚਰਣ ਕਮਲ ਪੂਜਾ ਪਰਚੰਦੇ
transliteration: Saadhasangati Pooran Brahamu Charan Kaval Poojaa Parachanday.
translation: Holy congregation is the  abode of the perfect Brahm and they (gurmukhs) keep their mind imbued  with the lotus feet (of Lord).

gurmukhi: ਸੁਖ ਸੰਪਟ ਹੋੲਿ ਭਵਰ ਵਸੰਦੇ ||੭||
transliteration: Soukh Sanpati Hoi Bhavar Vasanday ?7?
translation: They become the black bee and reside in the  pleasure-petals (of the holy Lord).

gurmukhi: ੮ ਗਿਅਾਨੀ ਲੱਛਣ
translation: Characteristics of a knowledgeable person

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਦਰਸਨ ਪਰਸਣੁ ਸਫਲੁ ਛਿਅ ਦਰਸਨੁ ੲਿਕ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਜਾਣੈ
transliteration: Gur Darasanu Parasanu Saphalu Chhia Darasanu Ik Darasanu Jaanai.
translation: Blessed is the Glimpse and the company of the guru because there only one visualizes God alone in all the six philosophies.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਬ ਦਿਸਟਿ ਪਰਗਾਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਲੋਕ ਵੇਦ ਗੁਰ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਪਛਾਣੈ
transliteration: Dib Disati Paragaasu Kari Lok Vayd Gur Giaanu Pachhaanai.
translation: Getting enlightened one identifies the teachings of Guru even in secular affairs

gurmukhi: ੲੇਕਾ ਨਾਰੀ ਜਤੀ ਹੋੲਿ ਪਰ ਨਾਰੀ ਧੀ ਭੈਣ ਵਖਾਣੈ
transliteration: Aykaa Naaree Jatee Hoi Par Naaree Dhee Bhain Vakhaanai.
translation: Having one women as wife he (the Sikh) is a celebate and considers any other's wife as his daughter or a sister.

gurmukhi: ਪਰ ਧਨ ਸੂਅਰ ਗਾੲਿ ਜਿੳੁ ਮਕਰੂਹ ਹਿੰਦੂ ਮੁਸਲਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Par Dhanu Sooar Gaai Jiu Makarooh Hindoo Mousalamaanai.
translation: To covet another man's property is forbidden ( to a Sikh) as the swine is to the Muslim and the cow to a Hindu.

gurmukhi: ਘਰ ਬਾਰੀ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਹੋੲਿ ਸਿਖਾ ਸੂਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਮਲ ਮੂਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਵਿਡਾਣੈ
transliteration: Ghar Baaree Gur Sikhu Hoi Sikhaa Sootr Mal Mootr Vidaanai.
translation: The sikh being a householder abnegates tonsure,the sacred thread ( Janeau), etc and forsakes them like abdominable faeces.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਗਿਅਾਨ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Giaanu Dhiaanu Gurasikh Siaanai.
translation: The Sikh of the Guru accepts transcendental Lord as the sole found af higher knowledge and the meditation.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਪਤਿ ਪਰਵਾਣੈ ||੮||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Mili Pati Paravaanai ?8?
translation: In the congregation of such people any body could become authentic as well as respectable.

gurmukhi: ੯ ੲੀਸ਼ਵਰੀਯ ਸ਼ਕਤੀ
translation: The divine power

gurmukhi: ਗਾੲੀ ਬਾਹਲੇ ਰੰਗ ਜਿੳੁ ਖੜੁ ਚਰਿ ਦੁਧੁ ਦੇਨਿ ੲਿਕ ਰੰਗੀ
transliteration: Gaaee Baahalay Rang Jiu Kharhu Chari Dudhu Dayni Ik Rangee.
translation: Though the cows are of different hues yet their milk is of the same (white) colour.

gurmukhi: ਬਾਹਲੇ ਬਿਰਖ ਵਣਾਸਪਤਿ ਅਗਨੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਹੈ ਬਹੁ ਰੰਗੀ
transliteration: Baahalay Birakh Vanaasapati Aganee Andari Hai Bahu Rangee.
translation: The vegetation has variety of trees but is the fire therein of  different colours?

gurmukhi: ਰਤਨਾ ਵੇਖੈ ਸਭੁ ਕੋ ਰਤਨ ਪਾਰਖੂ ਵਿਰਲਾ ਸੰਗੀ
transliteration: Ratanaa Vaykhai Sabhu Ko Ratan Paarakhoo Viralaa Sangee.
translation: Many behold the jewels but the jeweller is a rare  person.

gurmukhi: ਹੀਰੇ ਹੀਰਾ ਬੇਧਿਅਾ ਰਤਨ ਮਾਲ ਸਤਿਸੰਗਤਿ ਚੰਗੀ
transliteration: Heeray Heeraa Baydhiaa Ratan Maal Satisangati Changee.
translation: As the diamond interlaced with other diamonds goes in the  company of jewels, likewise the mind-diamond intertwined with the diamond like Guru Word goes in the string of the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤੁ ਨਦਰਿ ਨਿਹਾਲਿਓਨੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਨਿਹਾਲੁ ਨ ਹੋਰ ਸੁਮੰਗੀ
transliteration: Anmritu Nadari Nihaaliaonu Hoi Nihaalu N Hor Su Mangee.
translation: Knowledgeable people get blessed with the ambrosial sight of the Guru  and then have no desire whatsoever.

gurmukhi: ਦਿਬ ਦੇਹ ਦਿਬ ਦਿਸਟਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਜੋਤਿ ਅੰਗ ਅੰਗੀ
transliteration: Dib Dayh Dib Disati Hoi Pooran Braham Joti Ang Angee.
translation: Their body and vision turns divine  and their every limb reflects the divine light of the perfect Brahm.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਹਲੰਗੀ ||੯||
transliteration: Saadhasangati Satigur Sahalagee ?9?
translation: Their  relations with the true Guru are established through the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ੧੦ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਧਾਰਨਾ
translation: Gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਿ ਪੰਚ ਸਬਦ ੲਿਕ ਸਬਦ ਮਿਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Saadhasangi Panch Sabad Ik Sabad Milaaay.
translation: The Gurmukh while immersing his meditational faculty in the Word  listens to the Word alone even through the five types of sounds (created  through many instruments).

gurmukhi: ਰਾਗ ਨਾਦ ਸੰਬਾਦ ਲਖਿ ਭਾਖਿਅਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਸੁਭਾੳੁ ਅਲਾੲੇ
transliteration: Raag Naad Lakh Sabad Lakhi Bhaakhiaa Bhaau Soubhaau Alaaay.
translation: Considering the ragas and nadas only as the  medium, the Gurmukh discusses and  recites with love.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਧੁਨਿ ਜਾਣੈ ਜੰਤ੍ਰ੍ਰੀ ਜੰਤ੍ਰ ਵਜਾੲੇ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Braham Dhiaanu Dhouni Jaanai Jantree Jantr Vajaaay.
translation: Only the Gurmukhs understand the melody of the knowledge of the supreme reality.

gurmukhi: ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਵੀਚਾਰਕੈ ੳੁਸਤਤਿ ਨਿੰਦਾ ਵਰਜਿ ਰਹਾੲੇ
transliteration: Akad Kadaa Veechaari Kai Ousatati Nidaa Varaji Rahaaay.
translation: The Sikhs ponder on the words of the Ineffable, and abstain from praise  and blame.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸ ਅਵੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਮਿਠਾ ਬੋਲਣੁ ਮਨ ਪਰਚਾੲੇ
transliteration: Gur Oupadaysu Avaysu Kari Mitdaa Bolanu Man Parachaaay.
translation: Allowing the Guru's instruction to enter their hearts they  speak politely and thus comfort one another.

gurmukhi: ਜਾੲਿ ਮਿਲਨਿ ਗੁੜ ਕੀੜਿਅਾਂ ਰਖੈ ਰਖਣਹਾਰ ਲੁਕਾੲੇ
transliteration: Jaai Milani Gurh Keerhiaan Rakhai Rakhanahaaru Loukaaay.
translation: The Sikhs' virtues cannot be  concealed.  As a man may hide mollasses, but ants will discover it.

transliteration: Gannaa Hoi Koloo Peerhaaay ?10?
translation: As the  sugarcane gives juice when pressed in a mill, so must a Sikh suffer while  conferring favours on others.

gurmukhi: ੧੧ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਧਾਰਨਾ
translation: Gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਮਲ ਮਕਰੰਦੁ ਰਸਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਭਵਰ ਲੈ ਵਾਸੁ ਲੁਭਾਵੈ
transliteration: Charan Kamal Makarandu Rasi Hoi Bhavaru Lai Vaasu Loubhaavai.
translation: Like the black bee they surrender at the lotus feet of Guru and enjoy the  sap and remain happy.

gurmukhi: ੲਿੜਾ ਪਿੰਗਲਾ ਸੁਖਮਨਾ ਲੰਘਿ ਤ੍ਰਿਬੇਣੀ ਨਿਜ ਘਰਿ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Irhaa Pingulaa Soukhamanaa Laghi Tribaynee Nij Ghari Aavai.
translation: They go beyond the triveni of ira, pingala and  susumna and stablize in their own self.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਹਿ ਸਾਹਿ ਮਨ ਪਵਣ ਲਿਵ ਸੋਹੰ ਹੰਸਾ ਜਪੈ ਜਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Saahi Saahi Manu Pavan Liv Sohan Hansaa Japai Japaavai.
translation: They through the flame of breath,  mind and the life force, recite and make others recite the soham and hans  recitations (jap).

gurmukhi: ਅਚਰਜ ਰੂਪ ਅਨੂਪ ਲਿਵ ਗੰਧ ਸੁਗੰਧ ਅਵੇਸ ਮਚਾਵੈ
transliteration: Acharaj Roop Anoop Liv Gandh Sougandhi Avaysu Machaavai.
translation: The form of surati is wonderfully fragrant and  enrapturing.

gurmukhi: ਸੁਖ ਸਾਗਰ ਚਰਣਾਰਬਿੰਦ ਸੁਖ ਸੰਪਟ ਵਿਚਿ ਸਹਜਿ ਸਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Soukhasaagar Charanaarabind Soukh Sanpat Vichi Sahaji Samaavai.
translation: The gurmukhs  calmly absorb in the pleasure-ocean of the  Guru feet.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸੁ ਦੇਹ ਬਿਦੇਹ ਪਰਮ ਪਦ ਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phal Piram Rasu Dayh Bidayh Param Padu Paavai.
translation: When they in the form of pleasure-fruit obtain the supreme joy,  they go beyond the bondages of body and bodylessness and attain the  highest station.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਅਲਖ ਲਖਾਵੈ ||੧੧||
transliteration: Saadh Sangati Mili Alakhu Lakhaavai ?11?
translation: Such gurmukhs have the glimpse of that invisible Lord in  the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ੧੨ ਹੱਥਾਂ ਦੀ ਸਫਲਤਾ
translation: The usefulness of hands

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਹਥਿ ਸਕਥ ਹਨਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਗੁਰ ਕਾਰ ਕਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Hadi Sakad Hani Saadhasangati Gur Kaar Kamaavai.
translation: Worthy are the hands of the Sikh who in the holy congregation do the  Guru's work.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਣੀ ਪਖਾ ਪੀਹਣਾ ਪੈਰ ਧੋੲਿ ਚਰਣਾਂਮਤੁ ਪਾਵੈ
transliteration: Paanee Pakhaa Peehanaa Pair Dhoi Charanaamatu Paavai.
translation: Who draw water, fan the sangat, grind the flour, wash the  feet of Guru and drink the water therefrom;

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਬਾਣੀ ਲਿਖਿ ਪੋਥੀਅਾ ਤਾਲ ਮ੍ਰਿਦੰਗ ਰਬਾਬ ਵਜਾਵੈ
transliteration: Gurabaanee Likhi Potheeaa Taal Mridang Rabaab Vajaavai.
translation: Who copy the Guru's hymns  and play the cymbals, the mirdang, a small drum, and the rebeck in the  company of holy.

gurmukhi: ਨਮਸਕਾਰ ਡੰਡੳੁਤ ਕਰਿ ਗੁਰਭਾੲੀ ਗਲਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਗਲਿ ਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Namasakaar Dandaout Kari Gurabhaaee Gali Mili Gali Laavai.
translation: Worthy are the hands who bow, help in prostrating and  embrace a brother Sikh;

gurmukhi: ਕਿਰਤਿ ਵਿਰਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਧਰਮ ਦੀ ਹਥਹੁ ਦੇਕੈ ਭਲਾ ਮਨਾਵੈ
transliteration: Kirati Virati Kari Dharam Dee Hathahu Day Kai Bhalaa Manaavai.
translation: Who eam livelihood honestly and munificently  confer favour on others.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਸ ਪਰਸਿ ਅਪਰਸਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਪਰ ਤਨ ਪਰ ਧਨ ਹਥੁ ਨ ਲਾਵੈ
transliteration: Paarasu Parasi Aparasi Hoi Par Tan Par Dhan Hadu N Laavai.
translation: Worthy of praise are the hands of such a Sikh  who by coming in touch with Guru becomes indifferent to worldly  materials and lays not his eyes on another's wife or property;

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਪੂਜ ਕੈ ਭਾੲਿ ਭਗਤਿ ਭੈ ਭਾਣਾ ਭਾਵੈ
transliteration: Gur Sikh Gur Sikh Pooj Kai Bhaai Bhagati Bhai Bhaanaa Bhaavai.
translation: Who loves  another Sikh and embraces the love, devotion, and fear of God;

gurmukhi: ਅਾਪ ਗਵਾੲਿ ਨ ਅਾਪ ਗਣਾਵੈ ||੧੨||
transliteration: Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaavai ?12?
translation: He effaces his ego and does not assert himself.

gurmukhi: ੧੩ ਚਰਣ ਸਫਲਤਾ
translation: The usefulness of feet

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੈਰ ਸਕਾਰਥੇ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਾਰਗਿ ਚਾਲ ਚਲੰਦੇ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Pair Sakaaraday Guramoukhi Maaragi Chaal Chaladay.
translation: Blessed are the feet of the Sikhs who walk in Guru's way;

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੂ ਦੁਅਾਰੈ ਜਾਨਿ ਚਲਿ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਚਲਿ ਜਾੲਿ ਬਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Guroo Duaarai Jaani Chali Saadhasangati Chali Jaai Bahanday.
translation: Who go to the  Gurudwara and sit their in the holy congregation;

gurmukhi: ਧਾਵਨ ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰ ਨੋ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖਾ ਨੋ ਖੋਜਿ ਲਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Dhaavan Paraoupakaar No Gur Sikhaa No Khoji Lahanday.
translation: Who search out the  Guru's Sikhs and hasten to do them favours.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਬਿਧਾ ਪੰਥ ਨ ਧਾਵਨੀ ਮਾੲਿਅਾ ਵਿਚਿ ੳੁਦਾਸੁ ਰਹੰਦੇ
transliteration: Doubidhaa Panthi N Dhaavanee Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Rahanday.
translation: Worthy are the feet of the  Silk's who do not go on the way of duality and possessing wealth remain indifferent to it.

gurmukhi: ਬੰਦਿ ਖਲਾਸੀ ਬੰਦਗੀ ਵਿਰਲੇ ਕੇੲੀ ਹੁਕਮੀ ਬੰਦੇ
transliteration: Bandi Khalaasee Bandagee Viralay Kayee Houkamee Banday.
translation: Few are the people who abide by the orders of the  Supreme Commander, do Him homage and thus escape from their bonds;

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖਾ ਪਰਦਖਣਾਂ ਪੈਰੀ ਪੈ ਰਹਰਾਸਿ ਕਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Gur Sikhaa Paradakhanaan Pairee Pai Raharaasi Karanday.
translation: Who adopt the custom of circumambulating the Guru's Sikhs and falling at  their feet.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ਚੇਲੇ ਪਰਚੈ ਪਰਚੰਦੇ ||੧੩||
transliteration: Gur Chaylay Parachai Parachanday ?13?
translation: The Guru's Sikhs delight in such enjoyments.

gurmukhi: ੧੪ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਪਰੋਪਕਾਰੀ
translation: Gurmukh, the altruist

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਮਨਿ ਪਰਗਾਸੁ ਹੈ ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਅਾਲਾ ਅਜਰੁ ਜਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Gurasikh Mani Paragaasu Hai Piram Piaalaa Ajaru Jaranday.
translation: The enlightened mind of the Sikhs drinks and digests the unbearable cup  of the love of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਬ੍ਹਮ ਪੂਰਨ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਬ੍ਹਮੁ ਬਿਬੇਕੀ ਧਿਅਾਨੁ ਧਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Paarabrahamu Pooran Brahamu Brahamu Bibaykee Dhiaanu Dharanday.
translation: Armed with the knowledge of the Brahm, they  meditate upon the transcendental Brahm.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵਲੀਣ ਹੋੲਿ ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦ ਸੁਣੰਦੇ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Leen Hoi Akad Kadaa Gur Sabadu Sounanday.
translation: Merging their consciousness in  the Word-sabad, they recite the indescribable story of the Word-the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਭੂਤ ਭਵਿਖਹੁਂ ਵਰਤਮਾਨ ਅਬਿਗਤਿ ਗਤਿ ਅਤਿ ਅਲਖ ਲਖੰਦੇ
transliteration: Bhoot Bhavikhahoun Varatamaan Abigati Gati Ati Alakh Lakhanday.
translation: They are competent to see incomprehensible pace of the past, present and  future.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਖ ਫਲੁ ਅਛਲੁ ਛਲੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਵਛਲੁ ਕਰਿ ਅਛਲੁ ਛਲੰਦੇ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Achhalu Chhalu Bhagati Vachhalu Kari Achhalu Chhaladay.
translation: Never deluding fruit of joy, the gurmukhs get, and with grace of the  God, kind to devotees, they rather delude the evil propensities.

gurmukhi: ਭਵਜਲ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਬੋਹਿਥੈ ੲਿਕਸ ਪਿਛੇ ਲਖ ਤਰੰਦੇ
transliteration: Bhavajal Andari Bohidai Ikas Pichhay Lakh Taranday.
translation: They work  as a boat in the world-ocean and ferry across the millions who follow one  gurmukh, the Guru-oriented person.

gurmukhi: ਪਰੳੁਪਕਾਰੀ ਮਿਲਨਿ ਹਸੰਦੇ ||੧੪||
transliteration: Paraoupakaaree Milani Hasanday ?14?
translation: The altruist Sikhs always come up smiling.

gurmukhi: ੧੫ ਘਰਬਾਰੀ ਸਿੱਖ ਦੀ ਰਹਿਣੀ
translation: The conduct of the house holder Sikh

gurmukhi: ਬਾਵਨ ਚੰਦਨ ਅਾਖੀਅੈ ਬਹਲੇ ਬਿਸੀਅਰ ਤਿਸੁ ਲਪਟਾਹੀ
transliteration: Baavan Chandan Aakheeai Bahalay Biseearu Tisu Lapataahee.
translation: The snakes are said to be coiled around the sandal tree (but the tree is not  influenced by their poison).

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਸੁ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਪਥਰਾ ਪਥਰ ਪਾਰਸ ਹੋੲਿ ਨ ਜਾਹੀ
transliteration: Paarasu Andari Padaraa Padar Paarasu Hoi N Jaahee.
translation: The philosopher's stone exists among stones  but does not turn out to be an ordinary stone.

gurmukhi: ਮਣੀ ਜਿਨ੍ਹਾਂ ਸਪਾ ਸਿਰੀਂ ਓੲਿ ਭਿ ਸਪਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਫਿਰਾਹੀ
transliteration: Manee Jinhaan Sapaan Sireen Aoi Bhi Sapaan Vichi Dhiraahee.
translation: The jewel-holding snake also  roams about among the ordinary snakes.

gurmukhi: ਲਹਰੀ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਹੰਸੁਲੇ ਮਾਣਕ ਮੋਤੀ ਚੁਗਿ ਚੁਗਿ ਖਾਹੀ
transliteration: Laharee Andari Hansulay Maanak Motee Chougi Chougi Khaahee.
translation: From the waves of the pond, the  swans pick up only pearls and gems to eat.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁਂ ਜਲ ਕਵਲ ਅਲਿਪਤ ਹੈ ਘਰਿਬਾਰੀ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਤਿਵਾਹੀ
transliteration: Jioun Jali Kaval Alipatu Hai Gharibaaree Gurasikhi Tivaahee.
translation: As the lotus remains  unsmeared in water, the same is the position of the householder Sikh.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਸਾ ਵਿਚਿ ਨਿਰਾਸ ਹੋੲਿ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਜੁਗਤਿ ਜੀਵਾਹੀ
transliteration: Aasaa Vichi Niraasu Hoi Jeevanu Moukati Jougati Jeevaahee.
translation: He  residing among all the hopes and cravings around, adopts the skill of  liberation in life and lives (happily).

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਕਿਤੁ ਮੁਖਿ ਸਾਲਾਹੀ ||੧੫||
transliteration: Saadh Sangati Kitu Muhi Saalaahee ?15?
translation: How could one eulogise the holy  congregation.

gurmukhi: ੧੬ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਅਤੇ ਸਿੱਖ ੳੁਸਤੁਤਿ
translation: The True Guru and praise

gurmukhi: ਧੰਨੁ ਧੰਨੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਨਿਰੰਕਾਰਿ ਅਾਕਾਰ ਬਣਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dhannu Dhannu Satigur Purakhu Nirankaari Aakaaru Banaaiaa.
translation: The formless Lord has assumed the form of true Guru, the blessed one.

gurmukhi: ਧੰਨੁ ਧੰਨੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਸੁਣਿ ਚਰਣਿ ਸਰਣਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਜੁ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dhannu Dhannu Satigur Sikh Souni Charani Sarani Gurasikh Juaaiaa.
translation: Fortunate is the Sikh of the Guru who listening to the teaching of the Guru  has sought the shelter of the Guru-feet.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਾਰਗ ਧੰਨੁ ਹੈ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਤਿ ਮਿਲਿ ਸੰਗੁ ਚਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Maaragu Dhannu Hai Saadhasangati Mili Sangu Chalaaiaa.
translation: The way of the gurmukhs is  blessed on which one treads through the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਧੰਨੁ ਧੰਨੁ ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਚਰਣ ਧੰਨੁ ਮਸਤਕੁ ਗੁਰ ਚਰਣੀ ਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Dhannu Dhannu Satigur Charan Dhannu Masataku Gur Charanee Laaiaa.
translation: Blest is feet of  the true Guru and that head is also fortunate which reposes on the feet of Guru.

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਦਰਸਨੁ ਧੰਨੁ ਹੈ ਧੰਨੁ ਧੰਨੁ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਪਰਸਣਿ ਅਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Satigur Darasanu Dhannu Hai Dhannu Dhannu Gurasikh Parasani Aaiaa.
translation: The glimpse of the true Guru is auspicious and the Sikh of the Guru  is also blessed one who has come to have sight of the Guru.

gurmukhi: ਭਾੳੁ ਭਗਤਿ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਵਿਚਿ ਹੋੲਿ ਦੲਿਅਾਲੁ ਗੁਰੂ ਮੁਹਿ ਲਾੲਿਅਾ
transliteration: Bhaau Bhagati Gurasikh Vichi Hoi Daiaalu Guru Muhi Laaiaa.
translation: The Guru  loves happily the devotional feelings of the Sikh.

gurmukhi: ਦੁਰਮਤਿ ਦੂਜਾ ਭਾੳੁ ਮਿਟਾੲਿਅਾ ||੧੬||
transliteration: Guramati Doojaa Bhaau Mitaaiaa ?16?
translation: The wisdom of the Guru  decimates duality.

gurmukhi: ੧੭ ਸਫਲ ਸਮੇਂ
translation: The blessed time

gurmukhi: ਧੰਨੁ ਪਲੁ ਚਸਾ ਘੜੀ ਪਹਰ ਧੰਨੁ ਧੰਨੁ ਥਿਤਿ ਸੁ ਵਾਰ ਸਭਾਗੇ
transliteration: Dhannu Palu Chasaa Gharhee Paharu Dhannu Dhannu Diti Su Vaar Sabhaagay.
translation: Blessed is the moment, the blinking time, the hour, the date, the day  (during which you remember the Lord).

gurmukhi: ਧੰਨੁ ਧੰਨੁ ਦਿਹੁ ਰਾਤਿ ਹੈ ਪਖੁ ਮਾਹ ਰੁਤਿ ਸੰਮਤਿ ਜਾਗੇ
transliteration: Dhannu Dhannu Dihu Raati Hai Pakhu Maah Routi Sanmati Jaagay.
translation: Day, night, fortnight, months,  season and the year are auspicious wherein mind tries to rise (to divinity).

gurmukhi: ਧੰਨ ਅਭੀਚੁ ਨਿਛਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਹੈ ਕਾਮੁ ਕ੍ਰੋਧ ਅਹੰਕਾਰ ਤਿਅਾਗੇ
transliteration: Dhannu Abheechu Nichhatr Hai Kaamu Krodh Ahankaaru Tiaagay.
translation: Blessed is the abhijit nakstra which inspires to repudiate the lust, the anger  and the ego.

gurmukhi: ਧੰਨੁ ਧੰਨੁ ਸੰਜੋਗੁ ਹੈ ਅਠਸਠਿ ਤੀਰਥ ਰਾਜ ਪਿਰਾਗੇ
transliteration: Dhannu Dhannu Sanjogu Hai Atdasatdi Teerad Raaj Piraagay.
translation: That time is fortunte wherein (through meditation on God)  one gets the fruits of the holy dip at the sixty eight pilgrim centers and the  Prayagraj.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰੂ ਦੁਅਾਰੈ ਅਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਰਸ ਅੰਮ੍ਰਿਤ ਪਾਗੇ
transliteration: Guroo Duaarai Aai Kai Charan Kaval Ras Anmritu Paagay.
translation: Reaching the door of Guru (the Gurudwara) mind gets absorbed  in the delight of the lotus feet (of Guru).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰ ੳੁਪਦੇਸੁ ਅਵੇਸੁ ਕਰਿ ਅਨਭੈ ਪਿਰਮ ਪਿਰੀ ਅਨੁਰਾਗੇ
transliteration: Gur Oupadaysu Avaysu Kari Anabhai Piram Piree Anuraagay.
translation: Adopting the teachings of Guru,  the state of fearlessness and total absorption in the love (of Lord) is  attained.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਿ ਅੰਗਿ ਅੰਗਿ ੲਿਕ ਰੰਗਿ ਸਮਾਗੇ
transliteration: Sabadi Surati Liv Saadhasangi Angi Angi Ik Rangi Samaagay.
translation: Immersing the consciousness in the sabad (word) through and in  the holy congregation, every limb ( of the devotee) reverberates the lustre  of the (steadfast) colour of the Lord.

gurmukhi: ਰਤਨ ਮਾਲ ਕਰਿ ਕਚੇ ਧਾਗੇ ||੧੭||
transliteration: Ratanu Maalu Kari Kachay Dhaagay ?17?
translation: The Sikhs of the Guru have made  jewel garland of the fragile thread of breath (and they make full use of the same).

gurmukhi: ੧੮ ਘਰਬਾਰੀ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤ
translation: A liberated house holder

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਿਠਾ ਬੋਲਣਾ ਜੋ ਬੋਲੈ ਸੋੲੀ ਜਪੁ ਜਾਪੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Mitdaa Bolanaa Jo Bolai Soee Japu Jaapai.
translation: The polite language of a Sikh brings out what he thinks in his mind and  heart.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਅਖੀ ਦੇਖਣਾ ਬ੍ਹਮ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਧਰੈ ਅਾਪੁ ਅਾਪੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Akhee Daykhanaa Braham Dhiaanu Dharai Aapu Aapai.
translation: A Sikh beholds God everywhere with his own eyes, and that is  equal to a yogi's meditation.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸੁਨਣਾ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਕਰਿ ਪੰਚ ਸਬਦੁ ਗੁਰ ਸਬਦਿ ਅਲਾਪੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Sounanaa Surati Kari Panch Sabadu Gur Sabadi Alaapai.
translation: When a Sikh listens attentively to, or himself  sings, the word of God, that is equal to the five ecstatic sounds in the brain  of a yogi.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਕਿਰਤਿ ਕਮਾਵਣੀ ਨਮਸਕਾਰੁ ਡੰਡੳੁਤਿ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਪੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Kirati Kamaavanee Namasakaaru Dandaouti Siaapai.
translation: Earning livelihood with his hands by a Sikh is equal to the  obeisance and prostration (of Hindus).

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਮਾਰਗਿ ਚਲਣਾ ਪਰਦਖਣਾ ਪੂਰਨ ਪਰਤਾਪੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Maaragi Chalanaa Paradakhanaa Pooran Parataapai.
translation: When, the gurmukh, walks to  behold the Guru, that is equal to an extremely holy circumambulation.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਖਾਣਾ ਪੈਨਣਾ ਜੋਗ ਭੋਗ ਸੰਜੋਗ ਪਛਾਪੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Khaanaa Painanaa Jag Bhog Sanjog Pachhaapai.
translation: When the Guru oriented person eats and clothes himself, that is equal to the performance of Hindu sacrifice and offering.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਸਵਣੁ ਸਮਾਧਿ ਹੈ ਅਾਪੇ ਅਾਪਿ ਨ ਥਾਪਿ ੳੁਥਾਪੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Savanu Samaadhi Hai Aapay Aapi N Daapi Udaapai.
translation: When gurmukh sleeps,  that is equal to a yogi's trance and the gunnukh withdraws not his  thoughts from the object (God the Guru) of his concentration.

gurmukhi: ਘਰਬਾਰੀ ਜੀਵਨ ਮੁਕਤਿ ਲਹਿਰ ਨਹੀਂ ਭਵ ਲੋਭ ਬਿਅਾਪੈ
transliteration: Gharabaaree Jeevan Moukati Lahari N Bhavajal Bhau N Biaapai.
translation: The  householder is liberated in life; he is not afraid of the waves of the world's  ocean and fear does not enter his heart.

gurmukhi: ਪਾਰਿ ਪੲੇ ਲੰਘਿ ਵਰੈ ਸਰਾਪੈ ||੧੮||
transliteration: Paari Paay Laghi Varai Saraapai ?18?
translation: He goes beyond the region of  blessings and curses, and does not utter them.

gurmukhi: ੧੯ ਗੁਰਮੁਖ ਦੀ ਧਾਰਨਾ
translation: The realization by Gurmukh

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਗੁਰ ਸਤਿ ਸਰੂਪ ਹੈ ਧਿਅਾਨ ਮੂਲੁ ਗੁਰ ਮੂਰਤਿ ਜਾਣੈ
transliteration: Satiguru Sati Saroopu Hai Dhiaan Moolu Gur Moorati Jaanai.
translation: That the true Guru is the truth incarnate and is the basis of meditation is  well known (to gurmukh).

gurmukhi: ਸਤਿਨਾਮੁ ਕਰਤਾ ਪੁਰਖੁ ਮੂਲ ਮੰਤ੍ਰ੍ਰ ਸਿਮਰਣ ਪਰਵਾਣੈ
transliteration: Sati Naamu Karataa Purakhu Mool Mantr Simaranu Paravaanai.
translation: Satnam, Karta Purakh is accepted as the  basic formula, the muli mantr, by gurmukh.

gurmukhi: ਚਰਣ ਕਵਲ ਮਕਰੰਦ ਰਸੁ ਪੂਜਾ ਮੂਲ ਪਿਰਮ ਰਸ ਮਾਣੈ
transliteration: Charan Kaval Makarand Rasu Poojaa Moolu Piram Rasu Maanai.
translation: He accepting the sweet sap of  the lotus feet as fundamental, quaffs the joy of love for the supreme.

gurmukhi: ਸਬਦ ਸੁਰਤਿ ਲਿਵ ਸਾਧਸੰਗਿ ਗੁਰ ਕਿਰਪਾ ਤੇ ਅੰਦਰਿ ਅਾਣੈ
transliteration: Sabad Surati Liv Saadhasangi Gur Kirapaa Tay Andari Aanai.
translation: He  enters into the immersion of word-consciousness through the Guru and  the holy congregation.

gurmukhi: ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਪੰਥ ਅਗੰਮੁ ਹੈ ਗੁਰਮਤਿ ਨਿਹਚਲ ਚਲਣ ਭਾਣੈ
transliteration: Guramoukhi Pandu Aganmu Hai Guramati Nihachalu Chalanu Bhaanai.
translation: The way of the gurmukh is beyond the ken of mind  and speech and he in accordance with the wisdom of the Guru and his own  steadfast will, treads on it.

gurmukhi: ਵੇਦ ਕਤੇਬਹੁਂ ਬਾਹਰੀ ਅਕਥ ਕਥਾ ਕੳੁਣ ਅਾਖਿ ਵਖਾਣੈ
transliteration: Vayd Kataybahoun Baaharee Akad Kadaa Kaounu Aakhi Vakhaanai.
translation: Who can describe the importance of the  parable (of gurmukh) because it is beyond the Vedas and the Katebas, (the  four holy books of semitic religion).

gurmukhi: ਵੀਹ ੲਿਕੀਹ ੳੁਲੰਘਿ ਸਿਞਞਞਞਾਣੈ ||੧੯||
transliteration: Veeh Ikeeh Ulaghi Siaanai ?19?
translation: This way can be identified only by  crossing the limits and anxieties about the high and low of the world.

gurmukhi: ੨੦ ਮਨਮੁਖ ਗਤੀ
translation: Position of a Manmukh

gurmukhi: ਸੀਸ ਨਿਵਾੲੇ ਢੀਂਗੁਲੀ ਗਲਿ ਬੰਧੇ ਜਲੁ ੳੁਚਾ ਅਾਵੈ
transliteration: Seesu Nivaaay Ddheengulee Gali Bandhay Jalu Ouchaa Aavai.
translation: To get water from a stream or pond, the dhingali (a pole with a bucket one end and a fulcrum in the middle used for drawing water) is lowered by  catching hold of its neck, i.e. it is humbled forcibly and does not go down  of its own.

gurmukhi: ਘੁਘੂ ਸੁਝ ਨ ਸੁਝੲੀ ਚਕੲੀ ਚੰਦ ਨ ਡਿਠਾ ਭਾਵੈ
transliteration: Ghoughoo Sujhu N Sujhaee Chakaee Chandu N Ditdaa Bhaavai.
translation: The owl is not pleased on beholding the sun or chakavi; ruddy  sheldrake, the moon.

gurmukhi: ਸਿੰਮਲ ਬਿਰਖ ਨ ਸਫਲੁ ਹੋੲਿ ਚੰਦਨ ਵਾਸੁ ਨ ਬਾਂਸ ਸਮਾਵੈ
transliteration: Sinmal Birakhu N Saphalu Hoi Chandan Vaasu N Vaansi Samaavai.
translation: The silk cotton (simbal) tree yields no fruit and the  bamboo grows near the sandal but is not perfumed thereby.

gurmukhi: ਸਪੈ ਦੁਧੁ ਪੀਅਾਲੀਅੈ ਤੁਮੇ ਦਾ ਕੳੁੜਤੁ ਨ ਜਾਵੈ
transliteration: Sapai Dudhu Peeaaleeai Toumay Daa Kaurhatu N Jaavai.
translation: Given milk to  drink a serpent does not part with its poison and the bitterness of the colocynth also does not depart.

gurmukhi: ਜਿੳੁ ਥਣਿ ਚੰਬੜਿ ਚਿਚੁੜੀ ਲੋਹੂ ਪੀਅੈ ਦੁਧੁ ਨ ਖਾਵੈ
transliteration: Jiu Dani Chanbarhi Chichurhee Lohoo Peeai Dudhu N Khaavai.
translation: The tick clings to the cow's udder but  drinks blood instead of milk.

gurmukhi: ਸਭ ਅਵਗੁਣ ਮੈ ਤਨਿ ਵਸਨਿ ਗੁਣ ਕੀਤੇ ਅਵਗੁਣ ਨੋ ਧਾਵੈ
transliteration: Sabh Avagoun Mai Tani Vasani Goun Keetay Avagoun No Dhaavai.
translation: All these demerits I have and if any one do  me a favour, I return it with undesirable trait.

transliteration: Dom N Vaasu Kadooree Aavai ?20?6?
translation: Garlick can never have the  perfume of musk.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਅੰਤਿ ਬਿਸਮਾਦ ਫਲ ਦ੍ਰੁਮ ਗੁਰ ਸਿਖ ਸੰਧ ਗਤਿ
transliteration: Aadi Anti Bisamaada , Dhal Droum Gur Sikh Sandh Gati ?
translation: Just as the puzzle of seed and tree as to who came first is strange and perplexing, similarly strange is understanding the meeting of Guru and Sikh.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪਰਮ ਪਰਮਾਦਿ ਅੰਤ ਅਨੰਤ ਨ ਜਾਨੀਅੈ ||੧||੬||
transliteration: Aadi Param Paramaadi , Ant Anant N Jaaneeai ?1?6?
translation: This mystery of the beginning and end is beyond comprehension. Lord is beyond, away and infinite.

gurmukhi: ਫਲ ਦ੍ਰੁਮ ਗੁਰਸਿਖ ਸੰਧ ਗਤਿ ਅਾਦਿ ਅੰਤ ਬਿਸਮਾਦਿ
transliteration: Dhal Droum Gursikh Sandh Gati , Aadi Ant Bisamaadi ?
translation: Guru Ram Das caused the meeting of Guru and Sikh in the same wondrous way of fruit and tree.

gurmukhi: ਅੰਤ ਅਨੰਤ ਨ ਜਾਨੀਅੈ ਅਾਦ ਪਰਮ ਪਰਮਾਦਿ ||੨||੬||
transliteration: Ant Anant N Jaaneeai , Aad Param Paramaadi ?2?6?
translation: That perspective is infinite and no one can understand it. It is beyond, away and still away out of the reach of mortals.

gurmukhi: ਅਾਦਿ ਪਰਮ ਪਰਮਾਦਿ ਨਾਦ ਮਿਲਿ ਨਾਦ ਸਬਦ ਧੁਨਿ
transliteration: Aadi Param Paramaadi , Naad Mili Naad Sabad Dhouni ?
translation: Just as the sound of musical instruments melds with the words (of song/hymns), similarly Guru Ram Das and Guru Arjan became indistinguishable.

gurmukhi: ਸਲਿਲਹਿ ਸਲਿਲ ਸਮਾੲਿ ਨਾਦ ਸਰਤਾ ਸਾਗਰ ਸੁਨਿ
transliteration: Salilahi Salil Samaai , Naad Sarataa Saagar Souni ?
translation: Just as the river water becomes inseparable from the water of the ocean, Guru Arjan became one with Guru Amar Das by engrossing himself in his precepts and following them obediently.

gurmukhi: ਨਰਪਤਿ ਸੁਤ ਨ੍ਰਿਪ ਹੋਤ ਜੋਤਿ ਗੁਰਮੁਖਿ ਗੁਨ ਗੁਰ ਜਨ
transliteration: Narapati Sout Nrip Hota , Joti Gurmukhi Goun Gur Jan ?
translation: Just as son of a king becomes king, similarly Guru Arjan born as son to Guru Ram Das became an enlightened soul by singing the eulogies of Lord-a boon blessed to him by Satguru.

gurmukhi: ਰਾਮ ਨਾਮ ਪਰਸਾਦਿ ਭੲੇ ਗੁਰ ਤੇ ਗੁਰੁ ਅਰਜਨ ||੩||੬||
transliteration: Raam Naam Parasaadi Bhaay , Gur Tay Guru Arajan ?3?6?
translation: By the grace of Guru Ram Das, Arjan Dev succeeded him as Guru Arjan Dev.
